alert.note: Alert for Colorado Springs Vicinity, Southern El Paso County, Rampart Range Below 7400 Ft; Northern El Paso County, Monument Ridge, Rampart Range Below 7500 Ft; Teller County, Rampart Range above 7500fT, Pike's Peak Between 7500 And 11000 Ft (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 19 at 1:57PM MDT by NWS Pueblo
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Teller and northwestern El Paso Counties through 230 PM MDT... At 157 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Palmer Lake to near Woodland Park to 6 miles north of Divide. Movement was east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Palmer Lake around 200 PM MDT. Monument, Air Force Academy and Gleneagle around 205 PM MDT. Manitou Springs, Chipita Park and Cascade around 210 PM MDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Black Forest, Cimarron Hills and Falcon. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
